noun.definition: A cascade of water falling from a height, formed when a river or stream flows over a precipice or steep incline.
noun.example: The waterfall cascaded down the rocks.

verb.definition: To fall in or like a waterfall; to cascade.
verb.example: Her hair waterfalled down her back.

usage_examples: We hiked to the hidden waterfall.
The sound of the waterfall was very relaxing.
